description.full:
This file is part of
 zUIx, Javascript library for component-based development.
       https://zuixjs.github.io/zuix
description.summary:
This file is part of
 zUIx, Javascript library for component-based development.
       https://zuixjs.github.io/zuix

description.full: Function called when the data model of the component is updated
description.summary: Function called when the data model of the component is updated

description.full: Function that gets called after loading and before the component is created.
description.summary: Function that gets called after loading and before the component is created.

description.full: Function that gets called after loading, when the component is actually created and ready.
description.summary: Function that gets called after loading, when the component is actually created and ready.

description.full: Function called when the component is destroyed.
description.summary: Function called when the component is destroyed.

tags.string: {ContextControllerInitCallback} init Function that gets called after loading and before the component is created.
tags.name: init
tags.description: Function that gets called after loading and before the component is created.

tags.string: {ContextControllerCreateCallback} create Function that gets called after loading, when the component is actually created and ready.
tags.name: create
tags.description: Function that gets called after loading, when the component is actually created and ready.

tags.string: {ContextControllerUpdateCallback} update Function called when the data model of the component is updated.
tags.name: update
tags.description: Function called when the data model of the component is updated.

tags.string: {ContextControllerDestroyCallback} destroy Function called when the component is destroyed.
tags.name: destroy
tags.description: Function called when the component is destroyed.

code:
this._fieldCache = [];

// Interface methods
this.init = null;
this.create = null;
this.update = null;
this.destroy = null;
this._childNodes = [];

tags.string:
**Example - HTML code of the view** 


...


...
**Example - JavaScript** 

cp.field('title')
  .html('Hello World!');
var desc = cp.field('description');
desc.html('The spectacle before us was indeed sublime.');
{!string} fieldName Value to match in the `data-ui-field` attribute.
tags.name: fieldName
tags.description: Value to match in the `data-ui-field` attribute.

tags.string: {ZxQuery} A `{ZxQuery}` object wrapping the matching element.
tags.description: A `{ZxQuery}` object wrapping the matching element.

description.full:
Gets elements in the component view with `data-ui-field`
matching the given `fieldName`.
This method implements a caching mechanism and automatic
disposal of allocated objects and events.
description.summary:
Gets elements in the component view with `data-ui-field`
matching the given `fieldName`.
This method implements a caching mechanism and automatic
disposal of allocated objects and events.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// get all `checkbox` elements with `.checked` class.
var choices = cp.view('input[type="checkbox"].checked');
choices.removeClass('.checked');
// hide the component's view
cp.view().hide();

description.full:
Gets the component view or if `filter` argument is passed,
gets the view elements matching the given `filter`
(shorthand for `cp.view().find(filter)`).
description.summary:
Gets the component view or if `filter` argument is passed,
gets the view elements matching the given `filter`
(shorthand for `cp.view().find(filter)`).

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

var m = {
     title: 'Thoughts',
     message: 'She stared through the window at the stars.'
 };
cp.model(m);
cp.model().title = 'Changes';
console.log(cp.model().title);

description.full: Gets/Sets the data model of the component.
description.summary: Gets/Sets the data model of the component.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// somewhere inside the slide-show component controller
cp.trigger('slide:change', slideIndex);

// somewhere in a page hosting the slide-show component
// set component event listeners
zuix.context('my-slide-show')
  .on('slide:change', function(slideIndex) { ... })
  .on(...);

description.full:
Triggers the component event `eventPath` with the given
`eventData` object. To listen to a component event use the
`{ComponentContext}.on(eventPath, handler)` method or
in case `isHook` is set to true, use the
`zuix.hook(eventPath, handler)` method (global hook event).
description.summary:
Triggers the component event `eventPath` with the given
`eventData` object. To listen to a component event use the
`{ComponentContext}.on(eventPath, handler)` method or
in case `isHook` is set to true, use the
`zuix.hook(eventPath, handler)` method (global hook event).

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// somewhere in the `create` method of the {ContextController}
zuix.controller(function(cp){
  cp.create = function() {
    // ....
    cp.expose('setSlide', slide);
  }
  // ...
  function slide(slideIndex) { ... }
  // ...
});
// ...
// calling the exposed method
// from the component context
var ctx = zuix.context('my-slide-show');
ctx.setSlide(2);
{string|JSON} methodName Name of the exposed function, or list of method-name/function pairs.
tags.name: methodName
tags.description: Name of the exposed function, or list of method-name/function pairs.

tags.string: {function} [handler] Reference to the controller member to expose.
tags.name: [handler]
tags.description: Reference to the controller member to expose.

description.full:
Exposes a method or property declared in the private
scope of the controller as a public member of the
component context object.
description.summary:
Exposes a method or property declared in the private
scope of the controller as a public member of the
component context object.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// loads 'path/to/component_name.css' by default
cp.loadCss();
// or loads the view css with provided options
cp.loadCss({
    path: 'url/of/style/file.css',
    success: function() { ... },
    error: function(err) { ... },
    then: function() { ... }
});

description.full:
Loads the `.css` file and replace the current view style of the component.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load
the file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.
description.summary:
Loads the `.css` file and replace the current view style of the component.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load
the file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// loads 'path/to/component_name.html' by default
cp.loadHtml();
// or loads the view html with provided options
cp.loadHtml({
    path: 'url/of/view/file.html',
    success: function() { ... },
    error: function(err) { ... },
    then: function() { ... }
});

description.full:
Loads the `.html` file and replace the view markup of the component.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load the
file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.
description.summary:
Loads the `.html` file and replace the view markup of the component.
If no `options.path` is specified, it will try to load the
file with the same base-name as the `componentId`.

tags.string:
Example - JavaScript 

// same as log.info (...)
log.i('Component view', ctx.view());
// same as log.error(...)
log.e('Error loading data', dataUrl);
// other methods are:
// log.w(...) / log.warn (...)
// log.d(...) / log.debug(...)
// log.t(...) / log.trace(...)

description.full: The logger object is "attached" upon controller initialization.
description.summary: The logger object is "attached" upon controller initialization.

code: ContextController.prototype.log = {};

tags.string:
**Example - JavaScript** 

// Controller of component 'path/to/component_name'
var ctrl = zuix.controller(function(cp) {
    // `cp` is the {ContextController}
    cp.create = function() { ... };
    cp.destroy = function() { ... }
}).for('path/to/component_name');

description.full:
Register this one as the default controller
for the given component type.
description.summary:
Register this one as the default controller
for the given component type.
